sense.name: a beneficial chance or possibility
sense.commentary: OPPORTUNITY[+state][+circumstance][+favorable] a possibility due to a favorable combination of circumstances, a chance
sense.examples: The holiday gave us the opportunity to visit Washington. He sees an opportunity to exploit the perceived weakness of his opponent. There was never an opportunity to speak to her privately.

sense.name: an employment possibility
sense.commentary: OPPORTUNITY[+state][+circumstance][+opening][+employment] a job or employment possibility, opening
sense.examples: There were more finance opportunities in New York than in Detroit. John turned down an opportunity as marketing director of their firm. Mary is not interested in opportunities to sell insurance.
